verbose_text: Short-term strenuous exercise is known to augment fibrinolysis through increased t-PA levels, which is released from endothelial cells, and decreased plasminogen activator inhibitor (PAI) -1 levels, the primary inhibitor of t-PA that is released from activated platelets.
evidence: decreased plasminogen activator inhibitor (PAI)-1 levels, the primary inhibitor of t-PA
